             CS55500 HW5 - PROBLEM 1

The following knapsack consists of 47 integer components.
Each plaintext block of 7 ASCII characters is converted
using the same alphabet of 100 symbols (as for matrix for RSA homework)
to an integer X and then X to a binary vector V which is
then encrypted by means of the knapsack.  Each line of
the ciphertext is an encrypted block.

Hints:  M = the first prime greater than
             2036764117802210446778721319780021001
        
	W = the first prime greater than
	     127552671440279916013001
----------------------------------------------------------
